title: Arachnid or centipede
data:
The **arachnid or centipede** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the lowercase [s](/wiki/S "S") glyph (s). Arachnids and centipedes are designated internally by the macro `S_SPIDER`.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The monster class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- s [cave spider](/wiki/Cave_spider "Cave spider")
- s [giant spider](/wiki/Giant_spider "Giant spider")
- s [centipede](/wiki/Centipede "Centipede")
- s [scorpion](/wiki/Scorpion "Scorpion")
- s [Scorpius](/wiki/Scorpius "Scorpius")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Origin](#Origin)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [4.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 References](#References)

## Common traits

Monsters in the arachnid or centipede monster class are [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") [animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that have [limbs](/wiki/Limb "Limb"), but no [hands](/wiki/Hand "Hand"), and primarily attack via bites. They are [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")-aligned, with the exception of the chaotic Scorpius. Except for giant spiders and Scorpius, arachnids and centipedes are capable of [hiding](/wiki/Hiding "Hiding") under objects.

### Generation

Randomly generated arachnids and centipedes are always created hostile.

The arachnid or centipede is the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Tourist quest](/wiki/Tourist_quest "Tourist quest"). Some arachnids and/or centipides are also generated on a few levels within the quest branch at level creation: two are generated on the locate and goal levels, and one is generated on each of the lower filler level(s). The arachnid or centipede is also the second quest monster class for [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger"), and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest"); two random s are generated on the locate level at level creation, and one is generated on the goal level at level creation.

Arachnids and centipedes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under, even if they are incapable of actually hiding (as with giant spiders).[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## History

The scorpion first appears in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"); a possible predecessor in the giant scorpion appears in Hack for PDP-11, based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"). The giant spider first appears in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d") - from this version to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e"), the giant spider uses the s glyph in place of the scorpion if the SPIDERS [compile-time option](/wiki/Compile-time_option "Compile-time option") is defined, with the scorpion appearing otherwise.

[NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0") introduces the cave spider and establishes the monster class, with the giant spider and scorpion as default members; the centipede and Scorpius are introduced in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Origin

All monsters in the arachnid or centipede monster class are based on real life non-insect arthropods.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

- s [recluse spider](/wiki/Recluse_spider "Recluse spider")
- s [barking spider](/wiki/Barking_spider "Barking spider")
- s [carrion crawler](/wiki/Carrion_crawler "Carrion crawler")
- s [nickelpede](/wiki/Nickelpede "Nickelpede")
- s [giant scorpion](/wiki/Giant_scorpion "Giant scorpion")
- s [Girtab](/wiki/Girtab "Girtab")
- s [Shelob](/wiki/Shelob "Shelob")
- s [phase spider](/wiki/Phase_spider "Phase spider")
- @ / s [werespider](/wiki/Werespider "Werespider")

The Snake Pit in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") may generate one or two arachnids or centipedes at level creation.

[The Spider Caves](/wiki/The_Spider_Caves "The Spider Caves") generates ten random monsters from the arachnid or centipede class alongside Shelob, Girtab and the several spiders that inhabit the caves.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

- s [mirkwood spider](/wiki/Mirkwood_spider "Mirkwood spider")
- s [phase spider](/wiki/Phase_spider "Phase spider")
- s [demonic black widow](/wiki/Demonic_black_widow "Demonic black widow")
- s [mirkwood elder](/wiki/Mirkwood_elder "Mirkwood elder")
- s [yurian](/wiki/Yurian "Yurian")
- s [Shelob](/index.php?title=Shelob_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shelob (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- s [man-faced millipede](/index.php?title=Man-faced_millipede\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-faced millipede (page does not exist)")

The [Cartouche of the Cat Lord](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Cartouche_of_the_Cat_Lord "User:Chris/dNetHack/Cartouche of the Cat Lord") and [Sign of the Scion Queen Mother](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Sign_of_the_Scion_Queen_Mother "User:Chris/dNetHack/Sign of the Scion Queen Mother") are [wards](/wiki/Ward_\(dNetHack\) "Ward (dNetHack)") that can scare off arachnids and centipedes.

### notdNetHack

[notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") retains the monsters added in dNetHack, and adds one other new monster to the monster class:

- s [Chupoclops](/wiki/Chupoclops "Chupoclops")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds many new monsters to the monster class:

- s [large spider](/index.php?title=Large_spider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Large spider (page does not exist)")
- s [jumping spider](/wiki/Jumping_spider "Jumping spider")
- s [gargantuan spider](/index.php?title=Gargantuan_spider\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gargantuan spider (page does not exist)")
- s [drider](/index.php?title=Drider_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drider (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- s [giant centipede](/wiki/Giant_centipede "Giant centipede")

If the [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") monster spell is cast by [Lolth](/wiki/Lolth_\(EvilHack\) "Lolth (EvilHack)") or a [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") monster, they will summon arachnid or centipede monsters instead of [insects](/wiki/Insect "Insect").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 33](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L33)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 774](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L774)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1243](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L1243): *spiders and the like get a free house*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Arachnid or centipede

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The arachnid or centipede is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the lowercase s glyph (s). Arachnids and centipedes are designated internally by the macro S_SPIDER.[1]

The monster class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • s cave spider
  • s giant spider
  • s centipede
  • s scorpion
  • s Scorpius

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 notdNetHack
    • 4.4 EvilHack
  • 5 References

Common traits

Monsters in the arachnid or centipede monster class are carnivorous and oviparous animals that have limbs, but no hands, and primarily attack via bites. They are neutral-aligned, with the exception of the chaotic Scorpius. Except for giant spiders and Scorpius, arachnids and centipedes are capable of hiding under objects.

Generation

Randomly generated arachnids and centipedes are always created hostile.

The arachnid or centipede is the first quest monster class for Tourists, and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Tourist quest. Some arachnids and/or centipides are also generated on a few levels within the quest branch at level creation: two are generated on the locate and goal levels, and one is generated on each of the lower filler level(s). The arachnid or centipede is also the second quest monster class for Rangers, and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Ranger quest; two random s are generated on the locate level at level creation, and one is generated on the goal level at level creation.

Arachnids and centipedes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under, even if they are incapable of actually hiding (as with giant spiders).[3]

History

The scorpion first appears in Hack 1.0; a possible predecessor in the giant scorpion appears in Hack for PDP-11, based on Jay Fenlason's Hack. The giant spider first appears in NetHack 1.3d - from this version to NetHack 2.3e, the giant spider uses the s glyph in place of the scorpion if the SPIDERS compile-time option is defined, with the scorpion appearing otherwise.

NetHack 3.0.0 introduces the cave spider and establishes the monster class, with the giant spider and scorpion as default members; the centipede and Scorpius are introduced in NetHack 3.3.0.

Origin

All monsters in the arachnid or centipede monster class are based on real life non-insect arthropods.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

  • s recluse spider
  • s barking spider
  • s carrion crawler
  • s nickelpede
  • s giant scorpion
  • s Girtab
  • s Shelob
  • s phase spider
  • @ / s werespider

The Snake Pit in the Lawful Quest may generate one or two arachnids or centipedes at level creation.

The Spider Caves generates ten random monsters from the arachnid or centipede class alongside Shelob, Girtab and the several spiders that inhabit the caves.

dNetHack

dNetHack introduces several new monsters to the monster class:

  • s mirkwood spider
  • s phase spider
  • s demonic black widow
  • s mirkwood elder
  • s yurian
  • s Shelob
  • s man-faced millipede

The Cartouche of the Cat Lord and Sign of the Scion Queen Mother are wards that can scare off arachnids and centipedes.

notdNetHack

notdNetHack retains the monsters added in dNetHack, and adds one other new monster to the monster class:

  • s Chupoclops

EvilHack

EvilHack adds many new monsters to the monster class:

  • s large spider
  • s jumping spider
  • s gargantuan spider
  • s drider
  • s giant centipede

If the summon insects monster spell is cast by Lolth or a drow monster, they will summon arachnid or centipede monsters instead of insects.

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 33
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 774
  3. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1243: spiders and the like get a free house
